_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Sargento Foods, Inc., in Kiel, Wisconsin is a dairy processing plant with modern capabilities.
This recently constructed facility (1993) occupies about 175,000 square feet, and is situated on a 
40-acre parcel of land. The property is located in a predominantly rural area, on the northern 
outskirts of the City of Kiel. Adjacent properties to the northwest, north, northeast, east, and 
southeast are farmland or undeveloped land. Commercial-type properties are located to the south, 
southwest, and west. Residential properties are located to the southwest beyond the commercial 
properties. A few residences are located to the north.

Sargento Foods is committed to protecting the health and well being of their employees, the 
environment, and the community. Employee training programs are in place, including ammonia 
awareness training for all employees, annual emergency response training for the response teams 
and ammonia system training for the maintenance personnel.  Training and maintenance 
schedules are handled promptly and efficiently through the use of computer software.  The 
facility has a chemical labeling program and a spill prevention plan. Outside contractors must 
follow written contractor policies. Hot work permits are required. 

The ammonia refrigeration system was designed and installed in accordance with Wisconsin 
Administrative Code COMM Chapter 43 and ASTM standards. The system is a basic two-stage 
mechanical refrigeration system utilizing ammonia as the refrigerant. The total maximum 
intended inventory of ammonia within the refrigeration system at any time is approximately 
22,100 pounds. The facility is equipped with alarm and ammonia detection systems, which 
continually monitor the refrigeration system. Also, Sargento maintenance employees make daily 
inspections 365 days per year.

Sargento Foods has never had an accident involving the ammonia system that caused deaths, 
injuries, property damage, environmental damage or sheltering in place

. If an emergency were to 
occur, the local fire and hazardous response team would be notified and the emergency response 
procedures would be followed. The facility has an Emergency Action Plan, and employees have 
been trained how to use the plan. Emergency drills are conducted each year. The 
Manitowoc County Local Emergency Planning Committee has developed an offsite plan for the 
ammonia system and is aware of the procedures in case of a release or emergency situation. The 
local response teams are invited to visit the facility on a regular basis. Qualified trainers are 
retained from Lakeshore Technical College to conduct annual 8-hr Emergency Response refresher 
training.  The facility has several Facility Emergency Coordinators on each shift, who have been 
trained in Emergency Action Plan procedures and in coordination with outside response 
personnel.

The ammonia system at Sargento Foods?Kiel facility is covered by the Occupational Safety and 
Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management Plan (PSM) which requires the 
facility to manage system operations and develop emergency response and accident prevention 
programs. Sargento Foods has developed and implemented a PSM program for the Kiel facility. 
The PSM was audited in May 2001. A Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) was conducted in June 2004.  The PHA showed a great 
improvement in safety measures had been achieved as a result of addressing the concerns of the 
previous PHA.
